name: BIDSAppOPPNI
author: L. Mark Prati,  Strother Lab, Baycrest
command-line: Xvfb :88 -screen 0 1024x768x24 >/dev/null 2>&1 & sleep 4; export DISPLAY=':88'; python3 [OPPNI_LOCATION] [BIDS_DIR] [OUTPUT_DIR] [ANALYSIS_LEVEL] [PARTICIPANT_LABEL] [TASK_NAME] [ENVIRONMENT] -c pipeline_file.txt -r Sample_reference.nii [ANALYSIS_TYPE] [ANALYSIS_TYPE_ADJUSTMENTS] [TPATTERN] [PART] [CONVOLVE] [METRIC] [CONTRAST] [VASC_MASK] [NUM_PCS] [KEEPMEAN] [VOXEL_SIZE] [BLURTOFWHM] [DEOBLIQUE] [CONTROL_MOTION_ARTIFACT] [CONTROL_WM_BIAS] [OUPUT_NII_ALSO] --run_locally; status=$?;  kill %1 ; (exit $status)

inputs.name: OPPNI file
inputs.description: Path to the oppni.py version you are using, example ./oppni/cPRONTO/oppni.py

inputs.name: BIDS directory
inputs.description: The directory with the input dataset formatted according to the BIDS standard. (default OPPNI pipeline and refrence files should also be placed here)

inputs.name: Output directory name
inputs.description: The directory where the output files should be stored. If you are running a group level analysis, this folder should be prepopulated with the results of the participant level analysis.

inputs.name: Environment
inputs.description: Environment in which the pieline will be executed

inputs.name: Analysis_Level
inputs.description: Level of analysis that will be performed. Must begin with either 'participant' or 'group'. Multiple participant level analysis can be run independently (in parallel) using the same output_dir.

inputs.name: Participant_Label
inputs.description: The label(s) of the participant(s) to be analyzed. Label(s) corresponds to sub-<participant_label> from the BIDS spec (does not include 'sub-'). If not provided all subjects will be analyzed. Multiple participants can be specified with a space or comma separated list.

inputs.name: Taskname
inputs.description: Name of the fMRI task you want to analyze. Note all tasks in the data set will processed if not specified.

inputs.name: Anaylsis Type
inputs.description: Chosen analysis model (LDA, GNB, GLM, erCVA, erGNB, erGLM, SCONN, NONE). (oppni -a option)

inputs.name: Anaylsis Type Adjustments
inputs.description: Some analysis models allow for slight adjustments. Type in the flags. --decision_model,--drf,--Nblock,--WIND,--subspace,--spm. Please review the OPPNI manual to learn more.

inputs.name: T Pattern
inputs.description: Defines axial slices acquisition order for slice-timing correction - this must be specified whenever slice timing correction is requested. (oppni --TPATERN option)

inputs.name: Convolve Value
inputs.description: Binary value, determines whether user-provided design matrix (in split_info) should be convolved with the canonical HRF modeled by two gamma functions (AFNI’s “SPM1” function), for TASK pipeline step and GLM analysis.  0 = do not convolve and 1 = perform convolution (default =0)(oppni -convolve option)

inputs.name: Metric
inputs.description: Metric used to choose optimal pipelines standard options include ‘R’= reproducibility, ‘P’= prediction, ‘dPR= combined prediction & reproducibility (this is the default). (oppni -m option)

inputs.name: Contrast Combination
inputs.description: Task contrast being analyzed and optimized for. Necessary when more than two conditions are defined in the split_info files. Syntax: --contrast 'CON1-CON2,CON2-CON3', where CON1, CON2 are condition names (The condition number may be used instead, e.g. –contrast 1-2,2-3 ). Default is --contrast 1-2. (See Subsection 4.ii for more details)  If you are doing a single condition, choose ‘None’, whence this is omitted. NOTE: event-related analysis is *always* relative to baseline, e.g. --contrast “CON1-baseline”, as it is modelling HRF shape relative to baseline BOLD signal. (oppni --contrast option)

inputs.name: Vascular Mask
inputs.description: Toggles estimation of subject-specific vascular mask that would be excluded prior to analysis (0: disble, 1: enable). Default enabled. (oppni --vasc_mask option)

inputs.name: Number of PCs to Retain
inputs.description: NUMBER = total number of principal components to retain. (oppni --num_PCs option)

inputs.name: Keep Mean
inputs.description: KEEPMEAN=binary value that determines whether the output nifti files have temporal means re-added to each voxel after processing (default KEEPMEAN=1, not remove the mean scan), or the mean is removed and not replaced (KEEPMEAN=0). (oppni -k option)

inputs.name: Voxel Size
inputs.description: Determines the output voxel size of nifti file. Syntax: -v “[3.0 3.0 5.0]” gives 3x3x5 mm voxels as final results. Default is to keep output voxels the same size as input.  (oppni --voxelsize option)

inputs.name: Blur to FWHM
inputs.description: This option will enable adaptive spatial smoothing to equalize smoothing across multiple sites. Default 0. (oppni --BlurToFWHM option)

inputs.name: Deoblique
inputs.description: Corrects for raw data that are at an oblique angle relative to the cardinal scanning axes, using AFNI’s 3dWarp program. May improve the quality of registration. (oppni --DEOBLIQUE option)

inputs.name: Control Motion Artifact
inputs.description: Control for motion artifact. Default yes.  (oppni --control_motion_artifact option)

inputs.name: Control WM Bias
inputs.description: Control for white matter bias using spatial priors. Default no. (oppni --control_wm_bias option)

inputs.name: Output the nii also
inputs.description: Whether to output spms for all the optimal pipelines. (oppni --output_nii_also option)

output-files.description: Completion check for the project, existence implies the complete job was successfull.
output-files.name: Completion File Indicator
